term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - mean catalytic activity rate, Δz Δt
term.title: mean catalytic activity rate

item.text: The catalytic activity of a specified component in or moved from a system divided by the time during which the component was changed or moved. This kind of quantity should not be confused with rate of reaction.

sources.item: PAC, 1979, 51, 2451. 'Quantities and Units in Clinical Chemistry' on page 2475 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac197951122451)

term.citation: Citation: 'mean catalytic activity rate' in IUPAC Compendium of Chemical Terminology, 5th ed. International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry; 2025. Online version 5.0.0, 2025. 10.1351/goldbook.M03775

term.disclaimer: The International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC) is continuously reviewing and, where needed, updating terms in the Compendium of Chemical Terminology (the IUPAC Gold Book). Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
